Header.Name: BLAM-bundle-repository_v1.0
Header.Description: The Basic Language Archive Metadata Bundle profile aims to provide a basic metadata profile for language repositories. The profiles cover fundamental domain specific, but project independent, descriptive metadata as well as basic administrative and structural metadata. BLAM Bundle focusses on discoverability and human-readable display without a proliferation of data fields and work for the data producer.

CMD_Element.name: MDLicense
CMD_Element.Documentation: MDLicense element contains information about the license under which the metadata is made available.

CMD_Element.name: BundleID
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleID element contains an identifier that consistently and uniquely identifies the bundle described in the particular metadata token. The identifier should be generated by the repository during the ingest process.

CMD_Element.name: BundleVersion
CMD_Element.Documentation: BundleVersion contains the version number of the bundle.

CMD_Element.name: BundleDisplayTitle
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleDisplayTitle element provides a human readable name of the bundle. It should contain a meaningful and recognisable title for the bundle. The content of the BundleDisplayTitle element will be used as the human readable identifier in interfaces. Data producers can provide BundleDisplayTitle values for multiple interface languages. This field will be used as the human readable identifier for the bundle in citation and interfaces.

CMD_Element.name: BundleDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleDescription element provides a human readable description of the bundle. It should contain a description of the content of the collection. The content of the BundleDescription element will be used as the human readable description in interfaces. Its content can be queried by repositories for free-text metadata search.

CMD_Element.name: BundleRecordingDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleRecordingDate element contains the date at which a recording occured. The date must be provided conforming to ISO 8601 in the form YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY.

CMD_Element.name: BundleKeyword
CMD_Element.Documentation: BundleKeyword should contain a single keyword or keyphrase and should be used to describe the content and nature of data to enhance the discoverability and facilitate finer granularity for searches and browsing of the data. Repositories can use keyword metadata to define meaningful subsets of the data and provide a better browsing experience.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageDisplayName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageDisplayName element contains the name of the object language in the version recommended by the data producer. Repositories should tread the name provided by this element as the primary language name when displaying the metadata in relation to this particular data set (e.g. collection or bundle). The repository may use alternative names provided by services such as Glottolog or Ethnologue to improve discoverability and to enhance browsing and search experience.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageName element contains the name of the object language in the version as provided by services such as Glottolog or Ethnologue.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageISO639-3Code
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageISO639-3 element contains an ISO 639-3 language code for the object language.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageGlottologCode
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageGlottologCode element contains the Glottolog code for the object language as provided by glottolog.org.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageAlternativeName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageAlternativeName element contains an alternative name of the object language as provided by services such as Glottolog or Ethnologue.

CMD_Element.name: ObjectLanguageLanguageFamily
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ObjectLanguageLanguageFamily element contains the name of the language family and sub-families or sub-groups the object language belongs to. The values are taken from Glottolog and given in the version as provided by this service.

CMD_Element.name: BundleGeoLocation
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleGeoLocation element contains a geographical coordinates for a location point in the form “LATITUDE,LONGITUDE” as decimal degrees (e.g. 50.926735,6.930392 or -36.427925,150.076214).

CMD_Element.name: BundleLocationName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleLocationName element contains the name of a location in the version recommended by the data producer. Repositories should treat the name provided by this element as the primary location name when displaying the metadata in relation to this particular data set (e.g. collection or bundle). The repository may use alternative names provided by services such as GeoNames to improve discoverability and to enhance the browsing and search experience.

CMD_Element.name: BundleLocationFacet
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleLocationFacet element contains the name of a location provided by services such as GeoNames. This name is used to improve discoverability and to enhance the browsing and search experience. GeoNames field: “name” (or “toponymName”).

CMD_Element.name: BundleRegionName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleRegionName element contains the name of an administrative subdivision such as state, province, or any other politically salient administrative unit in the version recommended by the data producer. The data producer can decided which level of subdivision is relevant and will improve discoverability. Repositories should treat the name provided by this element as the primary location name when displaying the metadata in relation to this particular data set (e.g. collection or bundle). The repository may use alternative names provided by services such as GeoNames to improve discoverability and to enhance browsing and search experience.

CMD_Element.name: BundleRegionFacet
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleRegionFacet element contains the name of an administrative subdivision provided by services such as GeoNames to improve discoverability and to enhance browsing and search experience. GeoNames field: “adminName1”

CMD_Element.name: BundleCountryName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleCountryName element contains the name of the country to which the location belongs in the version recommended by the data producer. Repositories should treat the name provided by this element as the primary country name when displaying the metadata in relation to this particular data set (e.g. collection or bundle). The repository may use alternative names provided by services such as GeoNames to improve discoverability and to enhance browsing and search experience. The repository may also translate the name into other languages if no BundleCountryName name is given for a particular interface language.

CMD_Element.name: BundleCountryFacet
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleCountryFacet element contains the name of the country as provided by services such as GeoNames to improve discoverability and to enhance browsing and search experience. GeoNames field: “countryName”

CMD_Element.name: BundleCountryCode
CMD_Element.Documentation: The CountryCode element contains the ISO 3166-1 alpha 2 code of the country of the location as provided by services such as GeoNames GeoNames field: countryCode

CMD_Element.name: BundlePublicationYear
CMD_Element.Documentation: BundlePublicationYear contains the year of publication in the form YYYY conforming to ISO 8601. The default value is the ingest date into the repository unless an embargo has been set for the resource. In that case the end year of the embargo is taken as the year of publication. For legacy data, the value of BundlePublicationDate can be set to a point before the ingest. The value of this field should be used to generate a bibliographical citation reference for the resource.

CMD_Element.name: BundleDataProvider
CMD_Element.Documentation: BundleDataProvider contains the name of the data providing entity. The default value would be the name of the repository or its holding institution. The value of this field can be used to generate a bibliographical citation reference for the resource.

CMD_Element.name: CreatorNameIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: The CreatorNameIdentifier contains an URI that uniquely identifies the creator according to an established scheme. ORCID and INSI are considered best practices. An email address in the form of an mailto URI is a fallback.

CMD_Element.name: CreatorAffiliation
CMD_Element.Documentation: The CreatorAffiliation contains the organisational or institutional affiliation of the creator as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: CreatorFamilyName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The CreatorFamilyName element contains the part of the name of the creator that should be treated as the family name when generating a citation for the resource. This usage should guide the decision. If the name of a person consist of only one part, it should go here.

CMD_Element.name: CreatorGivenName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The CreatorGivenName element contains the part of the name of the creator that should be treated as the given name when generating a citation for the resource. This usage should guide the decision.

CMD_Element.name: ContributorNameIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ContributorNameIdentifier contains an URI that uniquely identifies the contributor according to an established scheme. ORCID and INSI are considered best practices. An email address in the form of an mailto URI is a fallback.

CMD_Element.name: ContributorAffiliation
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ContributorAffiliation contains the organisational or institutional affiliation of the contributor as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: ContributorRole
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ContributorRole contains the organisational or institutional affiliation of the contributor as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: ContributorFamilyName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ContributorFamilyName element contains the part of the name of the creator that should be treated as the family name when generating a citation for the resource. This usage should guide the decision. If the name of a person consist of only one part, it should go here.

CMD_Element.name: ContributorGivenName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ContributorGivenName element contains the part of the name of the creator that should be treated as the given name when generating a citation for the resource. This usage should guide the decision.

CMD_Element.name: ProjectDisplayName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ProjectDisplayName element provides a human readable name of the project. The preferred form is the abbreviation by which the project is generally known. The long form is best placed in the project description.

CMD_Element.name: ProjectDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The ProjectDescription element provides a human readable description of the project including full project name. It should contain a description of the project’s objective or activity. The content of the ProjectDescription element will be used as the human readable description in interfaces. Its content can be queried by repositories for free-text metadata search. Data producers can provide ProjectDescription values for multiple interface languages.

CMD_Element.name: FunderName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FunderName element provides the name of the funding organisation. The preferred form is the abbreviation by with the funding agency is generally known.

CMD_Element.name: FunderIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FunderIdentifier contains an URI that uniquely identifies the funding body according to an established scheme.

CMD_Element.name: GrantIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: GrantIdentifier contains an element that uniquely identifies the grant according to an established scheme. Best Practice: funding body specific identifier such as NSF grant number or BMBF Förderkennzeichen.

CMD_Element.name: GrantURI
CMD_Element.Documentation: The GrantURI contains an URI that uniquely identifies the grant and funding body according to an established scheme.

CMD_Element.name: SegmentationUnit
CMD_Element.Documentation: SegmentationUnit describes the criteria applied to segment the resource. This element applies to annotations of audio-visual data and is intended to facilitate the identification of useful data for a specific research question. The best practice is to use keywords. Examples: clause, intonation unit

CMD_Element.name: TranscriptionType
CMD_Element.Documentation: TranscriptionType describes the level of transcription of audio-visual data in the annotations. Data with no TranscriptionType metadata will be treated as not transcribed by the repository. Examples: phonemic, phonetic, orthographic

CMD_Element.name: TranslationLanguageName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The TranslationLanguageName element describes the annotation of the type translation. It contains the name of the language used in the translation. Data with no Translation metadata will be treated as not translated by the repository. Data with several Translation elements will be treated as having several translations.

CMD_Element.name: TranslationLanguageCode
CMD_Element.Documentation: The TranslationLanguageCode element describes the annotation of the type translation. It contains a language code (ISO 639-3) which identifies the language used in the translation. Data with no TranslationLanguage metadata will be treated as not translated by the repository. Data with several TranslationLanguage elements will be treated as having several translations.

CMD_Element.name: AnnotationType
CMD_Element.Documentation: AnnotationType describes the level and type of annotation of audio-visual data. Data with no annotation metadata will be treated as not annotated by the repository. Examples: word-by-word, PoS-Tagging, GRAID

CMD_Element.name: BundleIsIdenticalTo
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleIsIdenticalTo element contains an URI that uniquely identifies an identical resource. This element should only be used if it can be ascertained that the identified resource and the current resource will remain identical; else BundleIsDerivationOf should be used. The BundleIsIdenticalTo relationship is based on the `hasEquivalent` relationship of the Fedora Relationship Ontology (http://www.fedora.info/definitions/1/0/fedora-relsext-ontology.rdfs).

CMD_Element.name: BundleIsDerivationOf
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleIsDerivationOf element contains an URI that uniquely identifies the resource from which the current resource is derived. The BundleIsDerivationOf relationship is based on the `isDerivationOf` relationship of the Fedora Relationship Ontology (http://www.fedora.info/definitions/1/0/fedora-relsext-ontology.rdfs).

CMD_Element.name: Access
CMD_Element.Documentation: This element specifies the terms of availability of the resource in plain words. The technical implementation of these terms depends on the repository.

CMD_Element.name: AvailabilityDate
CMD_Element.Documentation: The AvailabilityDate element contains the date at which the bundle became or will become available. The date must be provided conforming to ISO 8601 in the form YYYY-MM-DD.

CMD_Element.name: LicenseName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The LicenseName element should provide the complete human readable name of a license and include version information if applicable.

CMD_Element.name: LicenseIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: The LicenseIdentifier provides a URI for the license.

CMD_Element.name: RightsHolderName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The RightsHolderName contains the name of the individual or institution owning or managing the rights over the resource.

CMD_Element.name: RightsHolderIdentifier
CMD_Element.Documentation: The RightsHolderIdentifier contains a URI that uniquely identifies the rights holder. In the case of an individual, this should be achieved by using an established scheme. Best Practice: ORCID, ISNI If an individual cannot be referenced by an identifier an email address should be given (in the form of a mailto URI).

CMD_Element.name: BundleIsMemberOfCollection
CMD_Element.Documentation: The BundleIsIPartOfCollection element contains a PID or DOI that uniquely identifies the collection the resource is part of. The BundleIsMemberOfCollection relationship is based on the `isMemberOfCollection` relationship of the Fedora Relationship Ontology (http://www.fedora.info/definitions/1/0/fedora-relsext-ontology.rdfs).

CMD_Element.name: FileName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileName element contains the name of the file as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: FilePID
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileID element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file described by this component.

CMD_Element.name: MimeType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specification of the mime-type of the resource.

CMD_Element.name: IsMetadataFor
CMD_Element.Documentation: The IsMetadataFor element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file described by the file described in this component. The IsMetadataFor relationship is based on the `isMetadataFor` relationship of the Fedora Relationship Ontology (http://www.fedora.info/definitions/1/0/fedora-relsext-ontology.rdfs).

CMD_Element.name: FileDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileDescription contains a human readable, file specific description. This element should be used to provide file specific that cannot be added to the bundle description. Any information applicable to the whole bundle should be added to the BundleDescription element.

CMD_Element.name: FileName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileName element contains the name of the file as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: FilePID
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileID element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file described by this component.

CMD_Element.name: MimeType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specification of the mime-type of the resource.

CMD_Element.name: FileLength
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileLength element contains the length of a media file.

CMD_Element.name: FileDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileDescription contains a human readable, file specific description. This element should be used to provide file specific that cannot be added to the bundle description. Any information applicable to the whole bundle should be added to the BundleDescription element.

CMD_Element.name: FileName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileName element contains the name of the file as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: FilePID
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileID element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file described by this component.

CMD_Element.name: MimeType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specification of the mime-type of the resource.

CMD_Element.name: IsAnnotationOf
CMD_Element.Documentation: The IsAnnotationOf element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file annotated by the file described in this component. The IsAnnotationOf relationship is based on the `isAnnotationOf` relationship of the Fedora Relationship Ontology (http://www.fedora.info/definitions/1/0/fedora-relsext-ontology.rdfs).

CMD_Element.name: FileDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileDescription contains a human readable, file specific description. This element should be used to provide file specific that cannot be added to the bundle description. Any information applicable to the whole bundle should be added to the BundleDescription element.

CMD_Element.name: FileName
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileName element contains the name of the file as provided by the depositor.

CMD_Element.name: FilePID
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileID element contains a PID that uniquely identifies the file described by this component.

CMD_Element.name: MimeType
CMD_Element.Documentation: Specification of the mime-type of the resource.

CMD_Element.name: FileDescription
CMD_Element.Documentation: The FileDescription contains a human readable, file specific description. This element should be used to provide file specific that cannot be added to the bundle description. Any information applicable to the whole bundle should be added to the BundleDescription element.
